snippet: The performer said on Instagram that he had a phone call with the Russian leader. The news went viral. The only problem: the Kremlin denies it happened.
abstract: Kremlin press secretary claims widely-reported phone call between Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin and singer and gay rights activist Elton John never took place; John had made Instagram post thanking Putin for call, which some now speculate may have been prank stemming from John's discussion of gay rights with Ukrainian Pres Petro O Poroshenko.

byline.contributor: Sophia Kishkovsky contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The performer said on Instagram that he had a phone call with the Russian leader. The news went viral. The only problem: the Kremlin denies it happened.

headline.main: The Détente That Wasn’t: Putin’s Call to Elton John
headline.print_headline: The Détente That Wasn’t: Putin’s Call to Elton John

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
